reviews.review_msg: Class with James was great and often funny too.

He is a lawyer who teaches this course and so very well. I hate early morning classes but his I looked forward to. He make a subject that is so dry very “sexy” and exciting with real world examples from his experience. I love that he gives context and then hypotheticals that we can relate to. I am really thinking of going into law.

Excellent! Best in my three years at BEEDIE. Knows the material well. Using his book on the subject which has some great study materials. Love his Friday classes. He is very entertaining when teaching. Love his classes. He does not suffer lazy students and those using cellphones in his class.  Taking employment law with him  now

I have taken two courses with Shafik so far (BUS 233 and BUS393) both of which have been incredible. He is such an amazing prof with his humour, real life examples to connect to lectures, and stories from his career being a lawyer. I hope to take couple more courses with him for sure. There is a reason his classes fill up so fast and get full!

He is a good proffesor and there is absolutely no doubt about this. He knows his stuff very well, uses different examples from the class to explain the stuff. The average for the course is so high.  If I would get a chance to do this course again, I wont do with him at all so that I can get a better grade! If you want an A, dont take with him.
The best professor I've had at SFU. He's a great lecturer and explains the material through real life examples which makes it so much easier to learn. I highly recommend attending his lectures!
Amazing prof. he is one of the best profs at SFU.
